name: waggishly
content:

in a way that is funny and usually very clever: The DVD includes a special feature in which the two lead actors comment waggishly on the action in the film. Our friends took us to a basement tavern waggishly named The Low Bar.
More examplesFewer examplesGroucho Marx once waggishly said, "Outside of a dog, a book is a man's best friend. Inside of a dog, it's too dark to read."When the match was postponed due to rain, the coach of the struggling team said waggishly, "I think that will help our chances."
